author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Bombay High Court administration has assigned a court to hear all the cases against underworld don Chhota Rajan in Mumbai. Mangesh Patil, Registrar-General of the High Court, said: “A court has been designated to hear all the cases against Rajan”.

“A request was made by the State government to the High Court administration before the court broke for Christmas vacation (December 23) and the approval for the same was also granted then,” he said.

“Judge S.S. Adkar, who sits at the City Civil and Sessions Court, will hear the cases,” Mr. Patil said.

Judge Adkar was earlier a district and additional sessions judge at Wardha. Asked when the court expected to start taking up all the cases, Mr. Patil said: “We don’t know, procedures are due and can’t say how much time it will take.”
title: Special court to hear cases against Rajan
